RI Masih Impor Garam? Edhy Prabowo: Terpaksa!
05 Nov 2019, 09:37 by Vadhia Lidyana


Menteri kelautan dan Perikanan Edhy Prabowo (Foto: Pradita Utama/detikcom)

Jakarta - Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan Edhy Prabowo menyebutkan keputusan impor garam industri adalah suatu keterpaksaan."Impor itu suatu keterpaksaan. Jika Anda lihat kalau ada impor itu terpaksa," ujar Edhy usai menghadiri rapat koordinasi di kantor Kemenko Perekonomian, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Edhy mengungkapkan, produksi garam dalam negeri dinilainya belum mampu memenuhi kebutuhan industri baik dari kualitas maupun kuantitas."Terus terang kalau dari kebutuhan nasional, kemampuan kita untuk melakukan produksi garam masih sangat baru setengahnya, mungkin kurang dari setengahnya," jelas Edhy.Selain itu, masih ada jenis garam yang belum diproduksi di RI namun dibutuhkan untuk industri. Misalnya garam dengan kandungan chlor alkali plan yang digunakan untuk bahan baku industri aneka pangan dan industri soda kostik."Dan ada di produksi dalam negeri kita yang memang mungkin tidak ada produksi. Misalnya garam yang mengandung chlor alkali plan itu kita belum ada," papar dia.Ia menuturkan, saat ini memang pihaknya tengah membangun pilot project untuk industri garam chlor alkali plan di Nusa Tenggara Timur (NTT). Namun, dari rencana luas tambak garamnya 400 Hektare baru terealisasi sekitar 4-6 hektare."Ada di NTT yg baru 4-6 hektare ini baru pilot project, yang rencananya 400 hektare ini yang akan terus kita dorong," kata Edhy.Sebagai informasi, pemerintah telah menetapkan kuota impor garam sebanyak 2,7 juta ton hingga akhir tahun 2019. Per Oktober 2019 impor garam industri sudah terealisasi sebanyak 2,2 juta ton. Simak Video "Impor Melimpah, Harga Garam Anjlok"[Gambas:Video 20detik](dna/dna)

RI Still Imports of Salt? Edhy Prabowo: Forced!
05 Nov 2019, 09:37 by Vadhia Lidyana


Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries Edhy Prabowo (Photo: Pradita Utama / detikcom)

Jakarta - Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries Edhy Prabowo said the decision to import industrial salt was a compulsion. "Imports are a compulsion. If you see that imports are forced," Edhy said after attending a coordination meeting at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs Office, Jakarta, Tuesday (5 / 11/2019). Edhy revealed, the domestic salt production was judged to have not been able to meet the needs of industry both in terms of quality and quantity. "Frankly speaking, from the national needs, our ability to produce salt is still only half of it, maybe less than half," explained Edhy. In addition, there are still types of salt that have not been produced in RI but are needed for industry. "For example, salt with an alkaline chlorine plan used as raw material for a variety of food industries and the cosmetics soda industry." And there is in our domestic production which indeed may not be produced. For example, we do not yet have an alkaline chlor containing salt. " He said, right now his party was building a pilot project for the alkaline chlor chlorine salt industry in East Nusa Tenggara (NTT). However, from the planned salt pond area of 400 hectares, only about 4-6 hectares have been realized. "In NTT, only 4-6 hectares of this new pilot project, the plan of 400 hectares of which we will continue to push," said Edhy. the government has set a quota of salt imports of 2.7 million tons until the end of 2019. As of October 2019 industrial salt imports have been realized as much as 2.2 million tons. Check out the video "Imports are Abundant, Salt Prices Drop" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (dna / dna)
